For the health sector, this includes 3.7bn for medical supplies, 16.5bn for bonus payments to health workers, and 8.9bn for the health sector’s development. For the economic impact, the law includes 20bn for allowances to the unemployed because of COVID, and 11.5bn for transfers to poor households. Everyone is at risk of getting COVID-19 and developing serious complications from the virus, but certain population groups are at higher risk and it is therefore more important for these groups to receive the vaccine as soon as it is available.     Initially, vaccines will be prioritized for three key population groups: older people, people with certain chronic conditions and key healthcare workers.    Older people   Evidence from both here in Qatar and around the world clearly shows that the risk of developing severe complications due to COVID-19 increases with age. People over 60 years of age have a higher risk of severe illness and death.     People with severe chronic conditions   People with certain long-term chronic medical conditions, including diabetes, asthma, and heart disease, or compromised immune systems, have an increased risk of developing severe complications as a result of COVID-19, regardless of their age.     Healthcare workers at high risk of exposure to COVID-19?    Healthcare workers, especially doctors, nurses and paramedics working directly with COVID-19 patients, have an increased risk of being exposed to COVID-19 and catching the virus and becoming sick. Additionally, healthcare workers who catch the virus can spread it to their patients, many of whom may be at increased risk of severe complications due to chronic conditions or compromised immune systems. ??  /web/20210209193238/https://covid19.moph.gov.qa/EN/Covid19-Vaccine/Pages/Priority-groups.aspx

Implementation date: 25-03-20  Many measures have been introduced to support SMEs and employees, at an estimated cost of 2% of the Tunisian GDP. The details are set out in the attached document, and are briefly summarised below.    TAX MEASURES    1. Postponing the Tax filing of the corporate income Tax (CIT) until the end of May 2020, excluding companies submitted to the rate of 35%.  2. Suspending all tax controls and all deadlines related to tax review procedures and objections until the end of May 2020.  3. Enabling all companies to recover Tax credits by accelerating the frequency of the refund committee meetings.  4. Activating the role of the National Committee and the regional reconciliation committees.  5. Revaluing real estate propriety recorded in the balance sheet according to its fair value.  6. Extending the deadline for the payment of vehicle circulation tax to the end of April 2020.  7. Amnesty for customs penalties.    FINANCE MEASURES    1. Creating a 500 million dinars investment fund to support permanent resources for companies that maintain jobs.  2. Creating a 100 million dinars investment fund with to repurchase capital shares of investment funds on companies operating in strategic sectors and having difficulties.  3. Creation of a monitoring and supporting unit to take care of companies most affected by the repercussions of the coronavirus.  4. Enabling affected companies to schedule their tax debts for a period of up to 7 years.  5. Enabling affected companies to suspend penalties related to late filing or a period of 3 months from 1 April to 30 June 2020.  6. Facilitating to these companies the procedures of recovering “VAT Credit”.  7. Enabling affected companies to obtain certificates of VAT & other taxes exemption and other fiscal certificates on written demand without delivering the required documents.  8. Launching a new mechanism to guarantee new operating loans provided by banks until December 31, 2020, to the tourism, transport, and other affected sectors.  9. Additional 300 million dinars funding to support existing financial facilities in supporting and promoting SMEs.  10. Implementing measures for the State to sponsor the difference between investment loans interest rate and the average interest rate in the financial market within 3 points for SMEs.  11. Investment mechanism to finance the purchase of equipment for hospitals and public health institutions.  12. VAT exemption for companies operating in the retailing and wholesaling of medicines.   13. Allowing fully exporting companies operating in the food and health industries to increase their sales ratio in the local market from 30% to 100% during 2020.  14. Allowing other fully exporting companies to increase their sales ratio in the local market from 30% to 50% during 2020.  15. Creating a fund to push the cultural sector and help companies and projects face the difficulties due to the cancellation of shows & cultural events.  16. Companies with public agreements which are blocked by COVID-19 are exempt from delay penalties for up to 6 months.  17. Banks and financial institutions should take all necessary measures to support enterprises and professionals in facing the repercussions of the COVID-19 crisis.  18. Banks and financial institutions shall postpone the payment of loan instalments granted to enterprises and professionals for which the principal and interest are due from March 1 2020 to the end of September 2020 and amend the payment schedule accordingly.   19. Central Bank of Tunisia provisions related to the conversion ratio (loans to deposits) are abolished, on an exceptional and temporary basis, for the first, second and third quarters of 2020, and replaced with other provisions.    SOCIAL MEASURES    1. Exceptional financial, circumstantial & direct aid for low-revenue vulnerable families and families hosting disabled people.  2.  Hosting people without a fixed abode in centres and dedicated areas through the “social assistance” mechanism.  3. Social assistance for employees (in case of enterprise’s closing or technical unemployment):  • Allow affected employees to receive social assistance in accordance with brief procedures to be established for this purpose.  • Postpone the release of bank credit maturities for a period of 6 months for employees whose monthly revenue does not exceed one thousand dinars.  • Maintain health care coverage, family allowances and wage increases for employees who have stopped working due to these economic difficulties.  4. Companies affected by the economic repercussions of COVID-19 can benefit from the postponement of employer social contributions for the 2nd  quarter of 2020 for a period of 3 months, to maintain jobs.  5. Committee set up to assist and support the affected enterprises under the supervision of the head of government,  5. Vigilance and assistance units set up to monitor implementation of assistance procedures.     https://archive.vn/ijaGi
